Module assegnamento2.assegnamento2
Package assegnamento2.assegnamento2.controller

Class ClientController

java.lang.Object
assegnamento2.assegnamento2.controller.Controller
assegnamento2.assegnamento2.controller.ClientController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public final class ClientController extends Controller implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The class ClientController represent the controller where we can control all the buttons and functionality of the Client fxml file. This class inherit from Controller class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    handleBuy()
    This method is used by the button "buy", to order a product to the client, in case of success the order will be saved in the cart of the same client and in case of failure the result is managed through alerts.
    void
    handleSearch()
    This method is used by the search button of the Client.fxml, to search for the various products that match the passed parameters; it comes also used the method searchProduct that is found in the Client class.
    void
    handleView()
    This method is used by the "View All" button, to print in the table all the products present in the store.
    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    This method is used initialize a controller after its root element has been fully processed.
    void
    readOrder()
    This method is used to read orders that are present in the DB_Order.XML file.
    void
    setClient(Client cli)
    This method is used to set the Client's object.
    void
    viewOrder()
    This method is used by the "Order" tab, to print in the table all the products in the client's cart.
    void
    writeOrder()
    This method is used to write the orders of the various customers in the DB_Order.xml file, but first it reads the same xml file to check if the orders are already present or not.

  • Method Details

    • setClient

      public void setClient(Client cli) throws ParserConfigurationException, IOException, SAXException
      This method is used to set the Client's object.
      Parameters:
      cli - is the Client's object.
      Throws:
      ParserConfigurationException - Indicates a serious configuration error.
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
      SAXException - Encapsulate a general SAX error or warning.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is used initialize a controller after its root element has been fully processed.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - It is the location used to resolve relative paths for the root object or null if the location is unknown.
      resourceBundle - It is the resources used to locate the root object or null if the root object has not been located.

    • handleSearch

      public void handleSearch()
      This method is used by the search button of the Client.fxml, to search for the various products that match the passed parameters; it comes also used the method searchProduct that is found in the Client class.

    • handleView

      public void handleView()
      This method is used by the "View All" button, to print in the table all the products present in the store.

    • handleBuy

      public void handleBuy() throws IOException, XMLStreamException, ParserConfigurationException, SAXException
      This method is used by the button "buy", to order a product to the client, in case of success the order will be saved in the cart of the same client and in case of failure the result is managed through alerts.
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - is used to report well-formedness errors as well as unexpected processing conditions.
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
      ParserConfigurationException - Indicates a serious configuration error.
      SAXException - Encapsulate a general SAX error or warning.

    • readOrder

      public void readOrder() throws ParserConfigurationException, IOException, SAXException
      This method is used to read orders that are present in the DB_Order.XML file.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
      ParserConfigurationException - Indicates a serious configuration error.
      SAXException - Encapsulate a general SAX error or warning.

    • writeOrder

      public void writeOrder() throws XMLStreamException, IOException, ParserConfigurationException, SAXException
      This method is used to write the orders of the various customers in the DB_Order.xml file, but first it reads the same xml file to check if the orders are already present or not.
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - is used to report well-formedness errors as well as unexpected processing conditions.
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
      ParserConfigurationException - Indicates a serious configuration error.
      SAXException - Encapsulate a general SAX error or warning.

    • viewOrder

      public void viewOrder()
      This method is used by the "Order" tab, to print in the table all the products in the client's cart.
